summary: This is an amended application and supporting affidavit by the U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) for a second warrant to obtain prospective and historical cellphone location data and pen register information for a phone subscribed to 'G Max', believed to be used by Ghislaine Maxwell. The filing corrects errors in a previous application and seeks to locate Maxwell following her indictment and the issuance of an arrest warrant for conspiracy, enticement, transportation of minors, and perjury.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: She is the attorney for the United States who respectfully submits the Amended Application for the warrant.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: She is the subject of an indictment and arrest warrant for conspiracy, enticement, transportation of minors, and perjury. The cellphone ('Target Cellphone') is subscribed to 'G Max' and is believed to be used by her.

persons.name: Isabel Maxwell
persons.context: Her phone ('Isabel Maxwell Phone') was in contact with the Target Cellphone in or about May 2020. She is identified as Ghislaine Maxwell's sister.

persons.name: Scott Borgerson
persons.context: An individual with whom Ghislaine Maxwell shares a joint bank account and to whom her Amazon account has sent packages. His phone ('Scott Borgerson Phone') was in contact with the Target Cellphone in or about March 2020.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: An attorney who represents Ghislaine Maxwell in civil litigation. Her phone ('Laura Menninger Phone') was in contact with the Target Cellphone within the last 30 days.

persons.name: Katharine H. Parker
persons.context: She granted the original application and signed the original Warrant and Order on June 29, 2020. She also administered the oath for the Amended Agent Affidavit on June 30, 2020.

persons.name: Lisa Margaret Smith
persons.context: She signed the warrant for Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest on June 29, 2020.

connections.description: Isabel Maxwell is identified as Ghislaine Maxwell's sister. Their phones were in contact as recently as May 2020.
They share a joint bank account, and Ghislaine Maxwell's Amazon account has sent multiple packages to him within approximately the last year.
Laura Menninger is an attorney who represents Ghislaine Maxwell in civil litigation. Their phones were in contact within the last 30 days.
The law firm Haddon, Morgan, & Foreman currently represents Ghislaine Maxwell in civil litigation. The Target Cellphone was in contact with a phone subscribed to the firm within the last 30 days.

events.title: Indictment and Arrest Warrant Issued for Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: A grand jury in the Southern District of New York returned an indictment charging Ghislaine Maxwell with conspiracy, enticement, transportation of minors, and perjury. Magistrate Judge Lisa Margaret Smith signed a warrant for her arrest.

events.title: Original Warrant for Cellphone Data Granted
events.description: Magistrate Judge Katharine H. Parker granted the government's original application and signed a Warrant and Order for cellphone location and pen register information for the Target Cellphone.

events.title: Submission of Amended Application
events.description: The government submitted this Amended Application and Amended Agent Affidavit to correct two inadvertent errors in the original Agent Affidavit regarding contact dates with the Isabel Maxwell and Scott Borgerson phones.

events.title: Last Contact with Isabel Maxwell Phone
events.description: The Target Cellphone was most recently in contact with the phone subscribed to Isabel Maxwell.

events.title: Last Contact with Scott Borgerson Phone
events.description: The Target Cellphone was most recently in contact with the phone subscribed to Scott Borgerson.

keyFacts: The document is an amended application for a warrant to track a cellphone subscribed to 'G Max', believed to be used by Ghislaine Maxwell, following her indictment and the issuance of an arrest warrant.

The application corrects two errors in a previous affidavit: the Target Cellphone's last contact with Isabel Maxwell's phone was in May 2020 (not within 30 days), and last contact with Scott Borgerson's phone was in March 2020 (not within 30 days).
The FBI agent's affidavit establishes probable cause that the phone's location will reveal Maxwell's location for arrest, noting recent contact with her attorneys' phones and her sister's phone.

The government requests a non-disclosure order to prevent the service provider (AT&T) from notifying the subscriber for one year, citing risks of flight, witness intimidation, and evidence destruction.
The requested surveillance includes 45 days of prospective location/GPS data, historical cell site data from June 1, 2020, and pen register information for call routing data.
